original: Beckhammar, Gustav Hugo, överste, Linköping, f. 30/10/95 i Örebro. G. m. Aina Högström. — Stud :ex. 14, off:ex. 18, flygsp :sk. 22, utb. t. flyg-pliförare 25, KHS 32-34, KSHS 34-35. Tjg. i gen:stab. 35-36. Fänr. v. Norrb. reg. 18, löjtn. 20, löjtn. v. flygv. 26, kapt. 31 o. major 38, chef f. sv. friv:kårens flygflottilj 40’, öv:löjtn. v. flygv. 41, chef f. Ostgöta flygflottilj sed. 41, överste 42. KSO, RVO-2’kl, 2 SkytteM, SvmifbSM, RLSFG-ftjt, SvPistfbSM, FFrK3klmsv, Chr-X:sFrM, FMM, FLstrm, FrLstrm.
translated: Beckhammar, Gustav Hugo, Colonel, Linköping, born on October 30th, 1895 in Örebro. Married to Aina Högström in a year unknown. He graduated from a general academic school in 1914, military academy in 1918, airborne school in 1922, and flight pilot training in 1925. He studied at the Royal Swedish Army Staff College from 1932 to 1934 and at the War College of the Swedish Armed Forces from 1934 to 1935. He served in the general staff from 1935 to 1936 and became a Second Lieutenant at Norrbotten Regiment in 1918, Lieutenant in 1920, Lieutenant at the Air Force in 1926, Captain in 1931, and Major in 1938. He was the leader of the Swedish Volunteer Air Force Flotilla in 1940 and became a Lieutenant Colonel in the Air Force in 1941. He was the leader of the Ostrogothia Air Force Flotilla since 1941 and became a Colonel in 1942. He received several awards including Knight of the Order of the Seraphim, Knight of the Royal Order of Vasa of the 2nd Class, 2nd Class of the Skytte Medal, Swedish Mediterranean Expeditionary Force Medal, Royal Life Saving Society Gold Medal, Swedish Pistol Shooting Federation Medal, Medal of the 3rd Class of the Swedish Freemasonry Order, Commander of Emperor Charles's Order, Military Merit Medal, Air Fleet Medal, and Life Saving Medal.
